commentBody: Brady and Peyton aside, this was a pretty good game and defenses do make the difference down the stretch, sure did in this case. Say what you want about Peyton, his arm, age, lack of mobility (how about those nifty clutch runs!) etc., he finally had a defense playing on his side and not across the line of scrimmage; he never had this in Indy and goodness knows what he would have done with the type of talent surrounding him that Brady ahs enjoyed most of his career. I hope Peyton goes out the way his boss did... a pretty good quarterback in his own right, maybe the best of his generation. Thanks for a fitting last paragraph which pretty much sums it up.
